page.title: 18Attitudes in Debenham (2).
page.content: Many Debenham inhabitants believe that the District Council should give a greater share of its resources to Debenham rather than to Stowmarket,the largest town in the Mid-Suffolk district.Plans to build a swimming pool at Stowmarket cause particular concern. Others argue that the proposed new council houses and additional sheltered accommodation show that Debenham gets a fair share of available money.It is felt by some that the school pools and grounds in Debenham should be made available for community use throughout the year. Other complaints concern the excessive amount ot parking in the High Street and the number of heavy lorries which pass through Debenham.The amount of litter has increased in recent years and public places are not kept clear of grass and weeds.
